intro: Uragoga mucronata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Uragoga mucronata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
